description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Funchal's Gardens" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Funchal's Gardens

places.generalDescription: Monte Palace Tropical Garden, located in Madeira, is a stunning garden surrounding the former pleasure estate and luxury hotel Quinta Monte Palace. The garden boasts a diverse collection of exotic plants from around the world as well as rare native species from Madeira. Created by local entrepreneur Joe Berardo in the late 1980s, this garden features an array of trees, flowers, fountains, ponds, waterfalls, statues, and Japanese-themed gardens with pagodas and carp ponds.

sources.snippet: The Portuguese have a talent for creating the world‚Äôs most romantic gardens, and Monte Palace Gardens are a prime example. Tropical greenery and blossoms seem to tumble down through a ravine to a plant-ringed pool with an island. Winding through this lush setting are paths and staircases bordered by walls of magnificent colored tiles.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Places for Couples to Dine in Madeira

sources.snippet: One of the most beautiful sights we‚Äôve ever seen and an incredible thing to do in Funchal is the Monte Palace Gardens. With lush, green plants and vibrantly-colored flowers perched around Japanese and Mediterranean structures, this is the perfect place to unwind. Read: Visiting the Monte Palace Gardens in Madeira
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 15 Wonderful Things To Do (2025 Madeira Guide)

places.name: Jardim Monte Palace Madeira

reviews.text: These are the most beautiful gardens we've been to. We arrived here via cable car from down in Funchal center and then we explored up here for the day. The gardens are kept immaculately and there are a lot of different gardens so you feel very secluded. This was definitely a highlight of our trip. There are lots of places to have snacks and sit down to admire the views and the terrain is quite hilly and cobbled.

Amazing botanical gardens that are truly stunning. The main themes seen to be Japanese and Africa, but their are plants from all continents. Its a vast and winding maze of interconnected pathways so takes a good few hours to fully explore, and easy to get lost. Also can be steep in places.

Best visited by the cable car from Funchal that stops right outside. There are cafes and a few random toilets dotted around, but take a packed lunch and just sit and enjoy the views whilst eating.

It can be noticably cooler in the gardens due to the altitude and cover, so dress accordingly and wear sturdy shoes. But definitely do go!

Beautiful place. Japanese style garden that's worth the visit......well maintained, some interesting exhibitions on top (art, minerals). When you spend your day exploring Funchal, we decided to do the garden in the morning, take the sleigh ride down the hill to Funchal city, walked around downtown and went back up the hill by cable car. A great day out and a nice change of scenery between hiking days.

places.address: Caminho das Babosas 4 A, Monte, 9050-288 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop the stunning island of Madeira, Jardim Monte Palace Madeira is a breathtaking multi-level garden that beckons nature lovers and photographers alike. This enchanting space boasts an array of exotic trees and vibrant flowers, serene ponds, and captivating African sculptures. As you meander through its lush pathways, you'll encounter ancient olive trees that have stood for over 2,000 years and a picturesque central lake teeming with swans and ducks. The garden also features an oriental section that adds to its charm.
places.name: Jardim Monte Palace Madeira

reviews.text: These are the most beautiful gardens we've been to. We arrived here via cable car from down in Funchal center and then we explored up here for the day. The gardens are kept immaculately and there are a lot of different gardens so you feel very secluded. This was definitely a highlight of our trip. There are lots of places to have snacks and sit down to admire the views and the terrain is quite hilly and cobbled.

Beautiful place. Japanese style garden that's worth the visit......well maintained, some interesting exhibitions on top (art, minerals). When you spend your day exploring Funchal, we decided to do the garden in the morning, take the sleigh ride down the hill to Funchal city, walked around downtown and went back up the hill by cable car. A great day out and a nice change of scenery between hiking days.

A stunning place that feels like an Asian-inspired botanical garden. Even though there were quite a lot of people, the grounds are so spacious that you can almost feel like you have it to yourself. On top of the beautiful nature, you'll also find impressive art installations and even a small museum with modern art. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Funchal and want to do something different than lounging by the pool or going on hikes.

places.address: Caminho das Babosas 4 A, Monte, 9050-288 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Madeira Botanical Garden is a hillside paradise boasting a bird park, natural history museum, and glass houses with stunning sea views. This modern marvel of contemporary architecture, co-designed by renowned architects Abalos & Herreros, features a unique latticed wooden canopy providing shade and dynamic interplay between light and shadow. The garden's design seamlessly blends with nature, offering visitors an immersive experience. Additionally, the Nini Design Center provides innovative spaces for exhibitions and workshops.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre someone who loves plants or is fascinated by gardens, then, you‚Äôre in for a treat as Madeira Botanical Garden is another excellent botanical garden in Funchal that you‚Äôll love. Similar to Monte Palace Gardens, the Madeira Botanical Gardens initially existed as a private estate. It opened in 1960 to the public after government acquisition and it‚Äôs now one of the must-see places on the island.
sources.siteName: Collective Travel Guides - Inspire to Travel
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Funchal, Madeira Right Now

sources.snippet: The Madeira Botanical Garden (Jardim Bot√¢nico) is the most extensive botanical garden in Madeira. Covering an area of eight hectares, this green space has a wide variety of trees and flowers, counting more than 2000 exotic plants from all continents.
sources.shortName: The 5 must-do things in Funchal (plus 15 nice-to-do's)

sources.snippet: Madeira is an island of flowers and Funchal is the city of gardens. Madeira Botanical Garden (Jardim Bot√¢nico). This is the biggest garden with the most varied collection of plants from all over the world.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)

places.name: Madeira Botanical Garden

reviews.text:
Lovely gardens but not the best time in July to go. The spring is supposed to be spectacular with all the flowers in bloom. Saying that the gardens are pretty, lots of mature trees sans shrubs.

Lovely little cafe to stop for that break.

Nice place to spend an hour and a half or two. It's not as interesting as the Monte Palace Gardens unless you are very interested in different plant/tree types but still a nice place to wonder around and see the variety of flora and fauna. The cafe in the gardens did some good food as well.

The Madeira Botanical Garden is one of the true gems of the island ‚Äì a place where nature, peace, and breathtaking views come together in perfect harmony. Visiting it is not just a walk through a garden, but a full sensory experience that leaves you refreshed and inspired.

From the moment you enter, you are greeted with spectacular terraces filled with vibrant flowers, exotic plants, and lush greenery that reflect Madeira's rich biodiversity. The garden is beautifully organized, with each area showcasing unique species from around the world, as well as plants that are native to Madeira and rarely found elsewhere.

One of the highlights is the famous patterned flower beds, arranged like a giant carpet of colors ‚Äì a masterpiece of natural design and a perfect spot for photos. Another unmissable feature is the panoramic view over Funchal and the Atlantic Ocean, which is simply breathtaking and makes the entire visit unforgettable.

Beyond the stunning beauty, the garden also has a strong educational aspect. The labels and explanations are clear and informative, offering insights into the extraordinary flora housed here. You feel both relaxed and enriched by learning about such diversity in one place.

The atmosphere is calm and welcoming, with benches and shaded spots where you can simply sit, take in the scenery, and enjoy a moment of peace. The staff maintain the grounds with great care, ensuring everything looks immaculate.

Whether you are a plant enthusiast, a photography lover, or simply someone who wants to connect with nature while appreciating one of Madeira's treasures, the Botanical Garden is an absolute must-visit.

üåø I left with my heart full of joy and my camera full of beautiful memories. This place truly shows why Madeira is called the ‚ÄúGarden of the Atlantic.‚Äù Highly recommended! üåø

places.generalDescription: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira is a luxurious century-old hotel with a classic British colonial decor. It offers spacious rooms and suites with large balconies overlooking the ocean, beautiful gardens, and multiple swimming pools. Guests can enjoy activities such as tango or foxtrot dancing classes and tennis lessons before indulging in award-winning cuisine at the hotel's restaurants. The iconic chequerboard tile dining terrace and attentive staff add to the hotel's elegant ambiance.

sources.snippet: Dating from 1890, Belmond Reid‚Äôs Palace is one of the most famous hotels in the world with past guests like Sisi (Austrian Empress), Winston Churchill, and Roger Moore to name just a few. Even if you are not staying at the hotel, you can go there for afternoon tea and enjoy the gorgeous panoramic views and superb service of a bygone era. It‚Äôs something special to do in Funchal and an affordable luxury experience, but you better book it in advance.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)

sources.snippet: The best Madeira hotel for old-world glamourFirst opened in 1891, Reid‚Äôs Palace is Madeira‚Äôs most famous grand dame hotel. Perched on a cliffside overlooking Funchal Bay, and skirted by 10 acres of colourful tropical gardens, ‚Äòthe pink palace‚Äô is the epitome of old-world glamour. A place so ostentatious that before Madeira's airport was built, guests arrived by boat and were carried to their rooms in hammocks.

places.name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira

reviews.text:
Can't say about the rooms, had afternoon tea here. Anyway, as stated, my wife & I had afternoon tea here as a joint birthday treat from my sister. Well, beautiful hotel in a stunning location. We were shown to our table & shown on the menu the selection of sandwiches, pastries etc we would be having. There were too many sandwiches to go through each one, but they were all delicious. Then the scones & cakes, again delightful, all very tasty.  Plus, we were offered more if the need took, yes, we did, but only a couple, rude not to. We were given unlimited pots of our respective teas during the eating. Then, to top it off, we had a cocktail each, which again was lovely, all topping the afternoon off brilliantly.
So if in mind a little treat, can't go wrong at Reids Hotel, Funchal. Oh, staff were amazing, very polite & attentive.

We only went here for drinks on the balcony. The view is gorgeous and the staff were attentive. My only complaint was that the staff inside the hotel - when finding bathrooms and when walking inside - seemed a to look down on us for not being hotel guests. But the waiters themselves were lovely!

What a fabulous hotel. A return to elegance and service of years gone by. If you prefer modernist, sterile hotels this isn't for you. But if you want style, unpretentious elegance and looking after. then this is the place. Staff are kind and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. The gardens were stunning. We only had 5 days but would gladly have stayed far longer. Highly recommend and intend coming back.

places.address: Estrada Monumental 139, S√£o Martinho, 9000-098 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: P√°tio das Babosas is a great Portuguese restaurant in the town of Funchal, Madeira. The food is delicious and the portions are large, making it perfect for a quick bite or a full meal. It can be quite busy so be prepared to wait awhile, but the views from the outdoor seating are worth the wait. The bar serves alcohol, and there is free wifi available.

sources.snippet: There are quite a few restaurants like this spread throughout the island, but our favorite two were P√°tio das Babosas and Restaurante O Cl√°ssico. The views, d√©cor, and food are worth more than you pay, with exceptional customer service.
sources.shortName: 6 Romantic Things to do in Madeira

places.name: P√°tio das Babosas

reviews.text:
Lovely restaurant, conveniently near the cable car, tropical gardens and toboggan ride. They have a nice patio with a great view down to Funchal.

The food was excellent, we had pizza, spaghetti and the local specialty; Espetada which was delicious.

The food came quickly, the service was good, the staff were friendly, and it was very reasonably priced.

Heartily recommended. Liked it so much, went there twice.

Very nice place to have lunch, with good options on the menu. The prices vary, but nothing is too expensive, at least not given the food quality and portion. The waiters are very kind and attentive. Eating on the terrace is a big plus!

Always extremely polite, service minded and helpful. And despite that I arrived rather late and they had almost closed the kitchen, I got my pizza! So thankful.
And when I said take away, the staff excused that he was alone and couldn't deliver it to my room!
I wasn't even thinking about that they could deliver it to my room.

places.address: Largo das Babosas 16, Monte, Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Sunrise Asian Fusion is a popular spot in Funchal, known for its authentic Nepalese cuisine and delicious sushi. The restaurant offers generous portions at fair prices, making it a great choice for those looking for a satisfying meal without the upscale atmosphere. Visitors have praised the friendly service and overall value of their dining experience. Additionally, the establishment's dinner special for two has received high praise for its outstanding food, service, and ambiance.

sources.snippet: Wrapping up warm and climbing the tallest peak to watch another dawn is a good plan at any time of year (just make sure the clouds play ball to ensure you get the full spectacle of the sun lighting up the peaks and valleys). To minimise the effort but still make a splash, call on the services of VANTASTIC (96 251 0484, gibrunchmadeira@gmail.com), a healthy concept designed by Ruben Freitas, offering cold-pressed fruit juices, functional plans and light refreshments. He will can also provide a basket with fruit juice, sandwiches and bowls to take with you to watch the sunrise (from ‚Ç¨14 per person).
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madeira

places.name: Sunrise Asian Fusion

reviews.text: Definitely try it out. Such a nice atmosphere and very nice service. Very personable and you're immediately in a good mood. The perfect positive vibes you need ! Orders are taken quickly and the food is served just as quickly. A large selection of Asian/Indian cuisine for eating. Tastes very fresh and very delicious. We will definitely come back. Sushi highly recommended !

We were looking for something fresh and tasty in a nice location and this placed ticked the boxes. Excellent service and lots of choice. It smelt great as soon as we walked in and we were not disappointed. We ordered a sushi boat which had lots of different types of delicious sushi and the mixed fried rice which was amazing. Very well priced as well. It filled up quickly around 7.30 so worth booking a table or getting there just before!

Such a great spot! The sushi was fresh, the butter chicken was one of the best I've had, and the veggie samosa was delicious. Pramod made the whole experience even better with his humor and awesome service! Highly recommend!

places.generalDescription: Quinta Magn√≥lia Tennis & Padel is a beautiful garden located on the grounds of a 19th-century house, now transformed into a hotel and restaurant. The garden offers free entry and features tropical and subtropical species typical of Funchal. It also boasts several tennis and padel courts that are always bustling with activity, as well as an excellent play park for children. Visitors can enjoy the fantastic cafe overlooking the padel courts, which serves reasonably priced meals and drinks, including alcohol.
places.name: Quinta Magn√≥lia Tennis & Padel

reviews.text:
Jardim Quinta Magn√≥lia in Funchal is an absolute gem, offering something for everyone. Nestled in the heart of the city, this park feels like a peaceful escape, yet it's within walking distance of everything Funchal has to offer. Whether you're looking to relax, stay active, or enjoy nature, this spot has it all.

For those seeking tranquility, the garden offers stunning views of both the Atlantic Ocean and the surrounding mountains, making it the perfect place to unwind. The walking tracks will keep you refreshed and energized as you explore the beautiful landscape. If you're with family, there's a fantastic play area for kids, plus tennis and paddle courts for a bit of friendly competition.

The garden is also home to an event management area, where you might get to enjoy live music, adding an extra layer of charm. The rich variety of trees and plants, along with the symphony of birdsong, create a truly enchanting atmosphere.

Quinta Magn√≥lia is not just a park, it's a little slice of paradise that will make you feel at home whether you're solo, with a partner, or with your whole family. It's a must-visit for anyone in Funchal, offering the perfect mix of relaxation, nature, and fun activities.

Petrolhead Heaven at its Finest ‚Äì Classics at Magnolia is a Must-Visit for Any Motoring Enthusiast

Attended Classics at Magnolia recently and was absolutely blown away. This wasn't just a car meet - it was a full-on celebration of engineering heritage, passion, and curation. Whether you're into American muscle, vintage British 4x4s, ultra-rare European icons, or just love mechanical art in motion, there's something here that'll stop you in your tracks.

Right off the bat, the atmosphere was spot-on. Held on the beautiful grounds at Magnolia, the field was completely packed with vehicles but never felt cramped or chaotic. It was well laid out, making it easy to stroll between rows and take in every machine properly. This wasn't just quantity - it was quality and variety, immaculately presented.

üöó Personal Highlights:

As the proud owner of an '84 Corvette back home, I was buzzing to see a 1958 Corvette on display. The chrome, the quad headlights, the curves - an absolute masterclass in American styling. I spent a good 15 minutes just soaking that car in. You could feel the pride in the presentation too - not just show-and-shine, but genuine appreciation for what that car represents.

Then there was the 1959 Cadillac. It looked like it had just driven off a Sinatra set - towering fins, sweeping lines, and enough chrome to reflect the entire countryside. There's something uniquely theatrical about late-'50s American luxury, and this Caddy absolutely nailed it.

The surprise standout for me was the small collection of Land Rovers from the 1950s - Series I and IIs, lovingly preserved or tastefully restored. Seeing those classic utilitarian shapes lined up next to sleek sports cars gave a brilliant sense of how broad the motoring world really is. You could almost picture them crawling through muddy farm tracks decades ago, still looking rugged today.

And let's not forget the very early motorcycles on show - some pre-war examples that looked like rolling sculptures. Simple, raw, and elegant in their design. A few marques I hadn't seen in person before, which is saying something.

üö§ Showstopper Moment:

There was even a Riva Aquarama on site - yes, the legendary Italian speedboat. That alone is a half-a-million-pound piece of rolling (floating?) luxury. With its gleaming mahogany hull and twin engines, it looked like it had been pulled straight from a Monaco postcard. Easily one of the rarest and most valuable pieces there - and a bold, beautiful choice to feature at a classic car show.

üí¨ Overall Vibe:

People were friendly, knowledgeable, and clearly passionate about what they'd brought. No ego, just shared appreciation and plenty of great conversations. You could talk to owners, swap stories, and learn a few unexpected facts even if you thought you knew the vehicle inside and out.

There must have been well over ¬£5 million worth of machinery on display, but the show never felt elitist or inaccessible. It struck that perfect balance between enthusiast gathering and public showcase.

üì∏ Tips:

Bring your camera - the visual mix is incredible.

Wear good shoes - it's all on grass.

Arrive early for parking and best light if you're taking photos.

And if you're a fan of a specific era or brand, give yourself time - there's more than enough to keep you busy.

üîß Final Verdict:

Classics at Magnolia is more than just a car show - it's a living museum, a community gathering, and a love letter to machines that still turn heads and stir hearts decades after they left the factory floor. I'll definitely be back next time, and if you're even remotely interested in automotive history, you should be too. An absolute five-star experience.

Visited this park when in Funchal, our hotel was directly in front of park,
Nice park, well maintained, lots going on Paddle tennis, tennis, a childrens play area.
The thing I did not like was the rabbit enclosure. Giant lopped eared rabbits in such a small enclosure with not enough space! Why have them! The park doesn't need this as it's got enough going on!
And I won't start on the love birds and budgie enclosure!

places.address: Rua Dr. Pita 10, 9000, S√£o Martinho, Funchal, Portugal

sources.snippet: Yacht charter in Madeira Island, with a very personalized service, and cut to the requirements of an elite market share. With a very stable sea, constant wind, crystal clear water and absolutely incredible views, Madeira is one of the most fabulous places in the World to sail, wither as a sport or for pleasure.

places.name: Sea La Vie - Madeira Yacht & Sailing Charter

reviews.text: Thank you to Sea La Vie for creating an unforgettable group experience! Jo√£o and Jo√£o were great hosts for our private tour of 8 people - providing drinks and tasty snacks, telling stories and history of the island, and suggesting things for our group to do. We took a sunset cruise in mid-April so it was a bit too chilly to swim, but we had a blast eating, drinking, chatting, and enjoying the beautiful coastline. This fantastic crew will not disappoint - highly recommend!

We had the best day on the boat yesterday! It was super clean and comfy, and the two Jo√£o's were so friendly and welcoming. They told us loads about the island's history in such an interesting way, and even sorted lunch for us. We were incredibly lucky to see rare whales, turtles, and flying fish. They also took us to a beautiful swim spot and had towels and a snack platter ready for us. Everything was so well done ‚Äì we all had an amazing time!

We had a fantastic experience on our private 3 hour sunset boat tour in Madeira with skippers Joao and Dario! The boat, Skyfall, was amazing, so comfortable in every way. Our hosts were able to locate dolphins for us, educated us on different aspects of Madeira, stopped for a swim and treated us to delicious snacks and wine throughout the trip. The 3 hour trip seemed longer and was well worth it! Interesting to see Madeira from a different perspective and worth the price to charter a private boat. Highly recommended the splurge!

places.generalDescription: Mercado dos Lavradores, a traditional indoor market established in 1940, is a popular attraction in Funchal. It offers an array of goods including fresh produce, flowers, and seafood. Visitors can explore the vibrant fruit stands showcasing guavas, dragon fruits, and lychees while enjoying a drink at the Madeira Beer Lab. The market also features a bustling fish section and flower stalls where locals sell beautiful blooms in traditional attire.

sources.snippet: Flowers are the cheapest and most fragrant way to win a fair maiden‚Äôs heart. You could always pick them from the garden and surprise the target of your affections for nothing, but it is always good to support local businesses, and there are Brownie points in that. Head on over to the Mercado dos Lavradores and ask the florists at the main entrance, who all wear traditional Madeiran dress, for some advice.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madeira

sources.snippet: In the heart of the Funchal city centre, Mercado dos Lavradores is open Monday- Saturday. Walk around and explore the hustle and bustle with vendors selling exotic fruits, fresh fish, and local delicacies. The Mercado dos Lavradores has been a staple in Funchal Madeira since the 1930s and is inside a two-story old art deco building.
sources.shortName: 24 Epic Things to Do in Funchal Madeira (Recommended) 2024

sources.snippet: Mercado dos Lavradores or the Farmers Market is Funchal‚Äôs central market, located in the Old Town and just around the corner from Santa Maria Street. The market is housed in an attractive two-storey building with a beautiful central courtyard. It‚Äôs a well-organised market with stalls that are grouped according to their offerings.
sources.siteName: Collective Travel Guides - Inspire to Travel
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Funchal, Madeira Right Now

sources.snippet: The Mercado dos Lavradores is a flower, fruit, vegetable, and fish market in Funchal. A short visit to this colorful bustling market is a must-do in Funchal!. The impressive building dates from 1940 and the inside space is organized in several different areas (‚ÄòPlazas‚Äô), connected by passages and staircases.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)

places.name: Mercado dos Lavradores (farmers' market)

reviews.text: The Mercado Dos Labradores is an essential visit when in Madeira. The market has a large range of artisan traders providing many quality goods and the food produce available is outstanding. There is also a superb fish market which if you visit in the morning is a thriving space full of amazing seafood. The fish market alone justifies the visit. Make stopping by and spending some time and money with the local traders here a priority when in Madeira.

Traditional market that has had to turn to tourism in order to survive. Today, almost all the stalls are focused on tourists - you'll rarely see a local shopping here. A clear example is the fish market square, where tourists don't buy and only a few stalls are still open, with hardly any customers. Meanwhile, fruit stalls selling at ‚Ç¨50/kg and souvenir stands are packed. These kinds of places deserve more protection. That said, I came to buy fruit for breakfast and was happy to find a wide variety available

This traditional market is great! Some stalls were full of people waiting to be served as they were so busy, the large fruit stall downstairs seemed to be a bit of a tourist trap, with pre wrapped fruit ready to eat, however if you venture up the stairs there is some amazing fruit stalls. As well as an incredible view of the fish tables with the workers cutting the fresh fish off as you order it. This was a lovely trip to this local market, I would recommend, just keep your wits about you for pricing and haggling techniques.

places.generalDescription: Design Centre Nini Andrade Silva is a must-visit attraction for those seeking a unique and immersive experience. The center features stunning gardens that seamlessly blend with nature, providing visitors with an unforgettable environment. It also houses an innovative museum designed by renowned architect Paulo David, showcasing gravity-defying contemporary architecture that contrasts beautifully with the traditional island surroundings. Inside, visitors can explore exhibition spaces, workshops, and a museum for study purposes.

sources.snippet: At Nini Design Center Restaurant in the studio/show room of the internationally known Nini Andrade Silva, you can admire her designs in the gallery before taking a table overlooking the harbor. Choose sea bream carpaccio with crab meat, or scallops in a creamy sauce with caviar and herbed risotto. Presentations are spectacular, as you might expect at a restaurant in the atelier of a preeminent designer.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Places for Couples to Dine in Madeira

places.name: Design Centre Nini Andrade Silva

reviews.text:
I've honestly never had better food, this was the best meal of my life. We had the tasting menu with wine pairings, and everything was absolutely delicious. Staff were very attentive too.
The only thing I would say is that portions were maybe a bit too big for a tasting menu, we left absolutely stuffed! But that is just an indication of how good value this place is for the quality that you get. Stunning views over Funchal too.

You can do much better!! Sorry guys, not worth the money!
First, when we arrived in the floor where the elevator lets you out, many employees were running around but no one cares about you. After we asked someone where the restaurant is, someone told us some kind of impolite: we have to wait at the small shop, someone picks us up. Ok üëç after the pickup, they brought us to the restaurant with another elevator. So far, so good.

There are four waiters running this restaurant. Only one is smiling while talking to you. The other ones are not interested and very neutral. üòê why is that? No smalltalk? Not even ONE was asking, if we liked the food after every course.
Only ‚Äûare you finished?‚Äú‚Ä¶

The Aperol Spritz was made with an old Prosecco and we got a new one after telling the bad quality of the Aperol. Also no one asked, if we want some wine for the dinner‚Ä¶
When the main course arrived, the waitress noticed, that there is no wine and asked us, if we want some‚Ä¶But much to late‚Ä¶sorry.

Come on guys! You had only 6-8 tables to serve with a team of 4!

The meals are really nice decorated and very tasty. No complaining about the food, but the service is a challenge.

Also: why is there 8 Euros for the bread and butter called ‚Äûcouvert‚Äú on the bill?
We didn't order that‚Ä¶ bread and butter is complementary in a restaurant. Why do you charge it as a service fee? After noticing that, I regret to gave you a tip, because you already grab 8 Euros for bread.

Don't get me wrong, the food is really tasty and really nice on the plate, but you could be Full House every night with a good service team.

Sorry guys, not worth the money! Not even a warm wish for the guests when they leave‚Ä¶
‚ÄûThank you for being with us‚Äú OR ‚Äûhave a good night‚Äú is a minimum I expect as a guest. So sad‚Ä¶ üòû that's the coldest service I had for a long time.

My recommendation: don't go there! There are tons of better places in town.

Beautiful restaurant with ocean view, superbly designed, and with impeccable service. The waiter was very knowledgeable about wine, and tool his time explaining each one, and even recommanding vineyards to visit on our trip according to our tastes. The ravioli, the red snapper, the meringue sorbet palate cleanser and the desert were all delicious. To give them a perfect score, I just wished they seasoned the sides that came with the black angus steak, they tasted a bit bland.

places.address: Estrada da Pontinha, Forte de Nossa Senhora da Concei√ß√£o, 9000-726 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: UauCacau is not your typical restaurant, but it's a must-visit chocolate shop in Funchal. Founded by master chocolatier Tony Fernandes, this place offers an array of delectable chocolate truffles, cakes, and other sweet treats. With over 40 different flavors inspired by the island's products like banana, mango, passion fruit, and Madeira wine, UauCacau promises a unique culinary experience.

sources.snippet: Chocolate comforts us when we are lonely; but is can also act as an aphrodisiac. If you want to conquer the object of your affections with food, then you should choose handmade chocolate produced right here on the island, with fillings like poncha, Madeira wine, pitanga and cane sugar honey. Add sugar to your relationship and get fat together.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madeira

places.name: UauCacau

reviews.text:
WOW caucau... That's how you pronounce it and that is how you feel after a visit.
Don't miss out on a visit to one of their shops in Funchal.

Only issue, they only exist in Funchal üò•

Delicious chocolates, bonbons with even more delicious fillings.
A most when in Funchal!!!!!!

I'm reviewing the chocolate itself, not the place. The location looks cool and has a chill vibe, but unfortunately, the chocolates were a big letdown. They are overwhelmingly sweet, to the point of being nearly inedible-like biting into pure sugar.

Perhaps this level of sweetness is common in Madeira, but it's worth noting that consuming something this sugary isn't great for health and could contribute to issues like diabetes.

To whoever makes these chocolates: please consider balancing the flavors by keeping the outer chocolate darker and less sweet, with the sweetness concentrated in the filling. In your current recipe, both the outer chocolate and the filling are excessively sweet, which overwhelms the palate.

They have lots of fabulous flavours in this chocolate shop. The chocolate itself is good. Some of the fruity flavours seem to be done with a jelly-like filling rather than a ganache, which has a different texture, but can probably carry more of that flavour.

places.address: R. Q.Baixo 11, S√£o Martinho, 9000-068 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Restaurante do Forte is a dining establishment located within the historic Sao Tiago Fortress, offering a unique and memorable experience. The restaurant boasts a diverse menu featuring both local and international dishes, with spectacular views of the harbor adding to the ambiance. The setting within the 17th-century fortress creates an elegant atmosphere, making it an ideal choice for a special evening out.

sources.snippet: Pack a more formal outfit and book dinner at the Forte, a restaurant that opened in 2001 in the Fortaleza de S√£o Tiago. Its ceiling is covered in floral wallpaper, its tables are well laid out with linen cloths, and the lights are low ‚Äì all creating a romantic atmosphere. As well as its √† la carte menu, it also has a range of packages to help create a romantic evening.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madeira

places.name: Restaurante do Forte

reviews.text: We booked the "Golden Package" and were very impressed with the service! We were picked up at the CR7 Hotel in a classic car and enjoyed a beautiful ride through Funchal on the way to the restaurant. While at the restaurant, the amazing service continued with extremely attentive waiters and amazing food! Everything we tried came out better than we could have possibly imagined. We were then whisked back in the classic car enjoying a beautiful night time drive through Funchal. It was a truly magical experience and I highly recommend everyone try it!

What a charming experience.  We got a reservation no problem, the restaurant filled up later but never got too crowded.  Our server Leo, was very attentive and had a great personality.  Sofia was also excellent.  The food was timed well and the wines paired nicely.  We did the 9 course meal and when they say ‚Äúdrinks included‚Äù they really mean it.  The wine was flowing and we left in very good spirits.  The chef personally brought out the entrees and he was also excellent and we enjoyed his visits as well.

Okay, being honest here, I'm an American who doesn't venture out much for dinner. We decided to try this place and was AMAZED with how insanely delicious this meal was. We went with one of the specialized dinner options and every dish we had was 10/10. They give the women blankets to keep them warm which is so lovely. They make sure your wine glasses are ALWAYS FULL. (P.S.- if you get one of the specialized dinner options all drinks are included 55e per person)!!!!! I WILL BE COMING BACK HERE!
